elements.title: Catharina Weiss (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Catharina Weiss (pictured) used to play for the Rolling Chocolate?

elements.title: invaded his country (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that King Minkhaung I of Ava lamented that King Razadarit of Hanthawaddy had invaded his country without "breaking a sword or a lance"?

elements.title: Andreas Vogt (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Andreas Vogt yelled "Down with the government! Long live the republic!" at a session of the Landtag of Liechtenstein in 1919?

elements.title: Battle Hymns (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that "Dark Avenger", a song from Manowar's album Battle Hymns, is narrated by actor Orson Welles?

elements.title: Mongrel (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that real paramedics were hired to portray EMTs in Mongrel, and they responded to a medical emergency that occurred in a village where they were filming?

elements.title: Dick Moss (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that labor lawyer Dick Moss argued the 1975 case which resulted in the establishment of free agency in Major League Baseball?

elements.title: School of the Arts, Singapore (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Louis Vuitton helped to develop the visual arts programme for the School of the Arts, Singapore?

elements.title: Danton Barto (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the University of Memphis football team posthumously retired Danton Barto's number following an online petition?

elements.title: Brussels Party Conference of the Communist Party of Germany (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 1935 Brussels Party Conference of the Communist Party of Germany took place in the outskirts of Moscow?
